alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:27AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Phelps, northwestern Kearney, southwestern Buffalo and southeastern Dawson Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 627 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elm Creek, or 15 miles east of Lexington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elm Creek around 635 AM CDT. Odessa around 645 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kearney. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 247 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
